title: Speedmates
description: Real-time chat app for uni students to connect based on shared interests. Responsible for the messaging feature of the application.
detailedDescription: Finding people at uni who were actually on your wavelength was surprisingly hard. All the time, I knew so many people who would complain about other students 'He is so messy!', 'She always comes back late and makes too much noise!' - so we built Speedmates to fix that. It's a real-time platform where students match based on interests and courses. Used Spring Boot for the backend, and Angular for the frontend. I was moreso in charge of implementing the messaging feature, in which I was responsible in implementing it's database schema, robust authentication for Messages and Chat access, and the polling-based chat architecture.
highlights: Built full real-time messaging system with WebSockets
Tested by university students with positive feedback

title: NLP News Classifier
description: An intelligent news classification system that uses real NLP techniques and neural networks to automatically understand and categorise news articles.
detailedDescription: This project was built as a deep dive into practical natural language processing and machine learning for my Object-Oriented Programming module. Instead of relying on simple keyword matching, the classifier cleans and processes raw news text, lemmatises it using Stanford CoreNLP, transforms words into meaningful numerical representations with GloVe embeddings, and feeds them into a neural network built with DeepLearning4J. The goal was to understand how modern NLP pipelines work end to end, while experimenting with vector semantics, optimisation strategies, and preprocessing techniques.
highlights: Word embeddings with pre-trained GloVe vectors
Full NLP preprocessing pipeline with lemmatisation and stop-word removal
features: Semantic word representation via GloVe embeddings
Neural network training optimised with Adam optimiser

title: Lyra - Voice-to-Music Platform
description: During BirmingHack 2025, we built a voice-to-music platform that turns voice descriptions into actual music using Deepgram's API.
detailedDescription: Hackathon project that we wanted to use, since Neuphonic representatives were present (they provide ultra low-latency TTS API's), and we wanted to win a bounty they had set out. The idea was simple... describe what you want to hear, and it generates music for you. Used Deepgram's API specifically for voice recognition because it's fast, then built the UI and visualisation of spotify embedding on top. We had only 48 hours to build it, which taught me alot about the importance of planning and development, and we used tools like Claude Code and Cursor to help with our short-lived planning and development, but it worked well enough to win. Judges seemed impressed by how quickly it could go from 'Stop, wait a minute' to a preview of 'Uptown Funk from Bruno Mars' they were singing.
features: Used Genius API to get lyrics

title: ResumeTail
description: Chrome extension that suggests resume improvements based on job postings.
detailedDescription: I got so tired of manually tweaking my resume for every application, so I built a Chrome extension that does it for me. So, when you're on LinkedIn with a job posting on your screen, click the extension, and it 1. screenscrapes the job posting and 2. parses your resume into a json object and then analyses both the posting and your resume to suggest specific improvements. Uses Groq's API Services and specifically the Claude Sonnet 3.5 model (though, you can clone the repository and configure a different model or even a local model). Once you submit your resume, you get AI-driven insights and suggestions based on what your resume has and what the job posting specifically wants. You are given things like a similarity score, a list of high-impact changes, low-impact changes, and some general structural changes for your resume. Resumes are stored in chrome.localstorage, so your device is essentially storing the data for you, no external servers.
features: Similarity percentage based on your resume and job posting

title: TechPad
description: AI-powered technical interview platform with real-time voice conversations, whiteboard and codepads to help users explain answers more accurately, and automated scoring with detailed feedback.
detailedDescription: Built a full-stack interview prep platform that actually feels like talking to a real interviewer. The AI generates contextual follow-up questions based on your answers, not just a rigid script. Used WebSockets for real-time voice interaction with ElevenLabs TTS for natural speech. Implemented a weighted scoring system across technical knowledge, problem-solving, and communication. Added Monaco Editor, whiteboard, and webcam support so you can code, draw diagrams, or just talk through problems. Integrated Stripe for subscriptions with a free tier (3 interviews) and unlimited pro access. The scoring engine analyses the entire conversation to provide evidence-based feedback rather than generic tips. Implemented Clerk and JWT token authentication for user management, and Stripe for subscriptions with a free tier (3 interviews) and unlimited pro access. The scoring engine analyses the entire conversation to provide evidence-based feedback rather than generic tips. Implemented Clerk with JTW Token Auth
highlights: Real-time voice interviews with adaptive AI questioning
Multi-modal tools: code editor, whiteboard, webcam
Weighted scoring engine with dimensional feedback
Stripe subscription system with webhook automation
features: Monaco code editor with syntax highlighting
Free tier (3 interviews) and Pro tier (unlimited)
Question caching to reduce API costs

title: relaiy.io
description: Gmail automation tool that turns plain English descriptions into safe, reviewable workflows. Essentially a no-code config creator for Gmail workflows.
detailedDescription: Got frustrated with Zapier's confusing interface and thought there had to be a better way. So, I am working on a system where you describe through natural language what you would like an 'Email worker' to schedule, and it generates a structured, deterministic configuration you can review before anything runs. The key principle: LLMs only generate configs, execution is fully deterministic, safe, and that the discretion of the user. Currently working on the config engine that converts natural language into primitives. Planning features like dry-run playground on test emails, action logging, and a version control system for workflows. Use cases include job application follow-ups, client onboarding, and anything repetitive.
highlights: Natural language to safe config generation
LLM for config only, deterministic execution
features: Pause, edit, or version control workflows (to-do)

title: UniEats
description: A smart recipe app for university students that turns fridge photos into meal ideas using what you already have.
detailedDescription: One time, I caught myself staring at my fridge with no idea what to make. With UniEats, which is designed for lazy university students (like myself), you are able to snap a photo, AI identifies ingredients, you select what's actually yours (ignore roommate's stuff), and get recipe suggestions filtered by your needsâ€”quick meals, high protein, budget-friendly, whatever. Working backwards from what you have rather than assuming you'll go shopping. Planning smart filters for time, fitness goals, and skill level, plus features like expiry tracking and meal prep planning.
features: AI ingredient detection from fridge photos (to-do)

title: Portfolio Website
description: A showcase of my motivations, my work experience, my skills, and my projects. You are literally looking at it. :/
detailedDescription: Could've used a template, but that isn't unique enough. So, using AI tools and UI/UX design strategies, I built a portfolio site in React to showcase projects and experience. Focused on clean design, fast load times, and actually being responsive on mobile. It's also a chance to experiment with new tech and design ideas without external requirements being up my *ss!
